explanation: To determine whether ahc_echo violates the MISRA rule forbidding direct or indirect self-calls, the analyzer must examine every function ahc_echo calls and the functions those callees call (transitive callees), because any of those could contain a path back to ahc_echo. The list therefore includes: (1) all functions called directly by ahc_echo (the primary callees), (2) the callees of those functions as shown in the provided static call graph (transitive callees), and (3) the callback symbols read_cb and free_cb passed into MHD_create_response_from_callback (these callbacks can execute later and could be a source of an indirect call into ahc_echo). Each named symbol is required because if it (or any symbol it calls) calls ahc_echo, that creates indirect recursion and hence a MISRA violation. An analyzer can use these symbols to perform a transitive reachability search from ahc_echo to check for any path that returns to ahc_echo.
